definition: Toktoghan (1314-1355), Mongol politician during the Yuan dynasty, prime minister until 1345, compiled three dynastic histories of Song 宋史, Liao 遼史|辽史 and Jin 金史/also written Tuoketuo 托克托
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
remarkably alike

sentences.english: The mouse Woods also quietly climbed Tuotuo hereby around, looked up the moon with him.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠呜兹也默默地爬到脱脱身边，陪着他抬头看月亮。

sentences.english: Tuotuo flapped ears and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 脱脱耷拉着耳朵，走开了。

sentences.english: Tuotuo was sitting near the water and watching the moon rise, there was an urge to howl.
sentences.chinese: 脱脱坐在水池边抬头看月亮，有一种想嚎叫的冲动。

sentences.english: The subjects had, indeed, risen vividly on my mind.
sentences.chinese: 画的题材倒确实活脱脱地浮此刻我脑海里。

sentences.english: Tuotuo has given the face to chewing slowly; chewing was pulpy but hard to swallow.
sentences.chinese: 脱脱很给面子地慢慢嚼着，嚼得稀烂却难以下咽。

sentences.english: When she drinks the wine, she will come down from the picture.
sentences.chinese: 饮酒这后，她就会活脱脱地从画中走出来。

sentences.english: The wars occurred between Timur and Toqtamish could be studied through two different periods.
sentences.chinese: 帖木儿与钦察汗脱脱迷失之间的战争分为两个阶段。

sentences.english: And I often grazed the cattle, living a life like that in fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 活脱脱一个标准的放牛娃，像童话一样。

sentences.english: Tuotuo're looking at the moon for Woos said.
sentences.chinese: 脱脱看着月亮对呜兹说。

definition: Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
History of the Jurchen Jin Dynasty, twenty second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed under Toktoghan 脫脫|脱脱[Tuo1 tuo1] in 1345 during the Yuan Dynasty 元[Yuan2], 135 scrolls
History of the Yuan Dynasty, twenty third of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Song Lian 宋濂[Song4 Lian2] in 1370 during the Ming Dynasty, 210 scrolls
History of the Liao Dynasty, twenty first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed under Toktoghan 脫脫|脱脱[Tuo1 tuo1] in 1345 during the Yuan Dynasty 元[Yuan2], 116 scrolls
Bayan (name)/Bayan of the Baarin (1236-1295), Mongol Yuan general under Khubilai Khan, victorious over the Southern Song 1235-1239/Bayan of the Merkid (-1340), Yuan dynasty general and politician
Timur or Tamerlane (1336-1405), Mongol emperor and conqueror

History of the Song Dynasty, twentieth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed under Toktoghan 脫脫|脱脱[Tuo1 tuo1] in 1345 during the Yuan Dynasty 元[Yuan2], 496 scrolls/(not to be confused with 宋書|宋书[Song4 shu1])
lit. progenitor of the Yuan Dynasty (1279-1368), title of Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty

Yelü Chucai (1190-1244), Khitan statesman and advisor to Genghis Khan and Ögödei Khan, known for convincing the Mongols to tax the conquered population of the north China plains rather than slaughter it
Yingzong, Temple name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3]

History of the Five Dynasties (between Tang and Song), eighteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Xue Juzheng 薛居正[Xue1 Ju1 zheng4] in 974 during Northern Song 北宋[Bei3 Song4], 150 scrolls
Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
Oirat Mongols (alliance of tribes of Western Mongolia) (Ming Dynasty term)
Zhao Gou, personal name of the tenth Song Emperor Gaozong 高宗[Gao1 zong1]
Gaozong Emperor, Temple name of the tenth Song Emperor Zhao Gou 趙構|赵构[Zhao4 Gou4] (1107-1187 AD), reigned (1127-1162 AD)
